tit.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線

sen.j: 東西線（とうざいせん）は、京都府宇治市の六地蔵駅から京都市右京区の太秦天神川駅までを結ぶ京都市営地下鉄の路線である。
sen.e: The Tozai Line is a railway line of Kyoto City Subway, which connects Rokujizo Station in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Tozai Line is a railway line of Kyoto City Subway, which connects Rokujizo Station in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Tozai Line is a railway line of Kyoto Municipal Subway, which connects Rokujizo Station in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 京都市で2番目の市営地下鉄路線として開業した。
sen.e: The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway started its operation as the second municipal subway line.
The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway started its operations as the second municipal subway line.
The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway started its operations as the second municipal subway line.

sen.j: 京都市中心部と同市東南部の山科区・伏見区との通勤輸送、及び滋賀県大津市との都市間輸送の一部を担う路線であり、1日平均12万人が利用している。
sen.e: Used by an average of 120 thousand people per day, it is a railway track that acts as a commuting traffic way connecting the section between the center of Kyoto City, and Yamashina Ward and Fushimi Ward, the south-eastern area of Kyoto City, and a part of transportation between Kyoto City and Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture

Used by an average of 120,000 people per day, it's a railway track that acts as a commuter-traffic route connecting the section between the center of Kyoto City and the Yamashina and Fushimi wards, and the southeastern area of Kyoto City; it also serves as a transportation route between Kyoto City and Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

Used by an average of 120,000 people per day, it's a railway track that acts as a commuter-traffic route connecting the section between the center of Kyoto City and the Yamashina and Fushimi wards, which are located in the southeastern area of Kyoto City; it also serves as a transportation route between Kyoto City and Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 同市東南部 のかかり方を変更しました。

sen.j: 1997年に醍醐駅 (京都府)～二条駅間が開業し、2004年に醍醐駅から六地蔵駅まで延伸、2008年1月16日には二条駅から太秦天神川駅までが開業した。
sen.e: The section between Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nijo Station was first opened to traffic in 1997, the section between Daigo Station and Rokujizo Station was added in 2004, and the section between Nijo Station and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station was opened to traffic on January 16, 2008.

The section between Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nijo Station was first opened to traffic in 1997, the section between Daigo Station and Rokujizo Station was added in 2004, and the section between Nijo Station and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station was opened to traffic on January 16, 2008.

The section between Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nijo Station was first opened to traffic in 1997, the section between Daigo Station and Rokujizo Station was added in 2004, and the section between Nijo Station and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station was opened to traffic on January 16, 2008.

sen.j: 同駅からはさらに西京区の洛西付近までの延伸が予定されている。
sen.e: It is scheduled to further extend the section up to near Rakusai in Nishikyo Ward.
It is scheduled that the section will be further extended up to near Rakusai in Nishikyo Ward.
It is scheduled that the section will be further extended up to near Rakusai in Nishikyo Ward.

sen.j: 市の郊外に洛西ニュータウンが建設された際、「将来ここまで地下鉄が来る」という話を聞いて入居した人が多く、住民から延伸を望む声が強いが、京都市の財政事情が厳しいことから建設の見通しは立っていない（詳細は西部への延伸構想）。
sen.e: When Rakusai New Town was constructed on the city outskirts, many people moved in as they had heard that the subway line would be extended up to this area in the future, and thus most of them strongly hope the extension of the line; however, the plan is nowhere in sight because of the strained state of Kyoto City's public finance (for details, see "Extension plan to the west.").

When Rakusai New Town was constructed on the city's outskirts, many people moved in because they'd heard that the subway line would be extended up to this area in the future, and thus most were very hopeful regarding the extension of the line; however, the plan is nowhere in sight because of the strained state of Kyoto City's public finances (for details, see "Extension plan to the west").

When Rakusai New Town was constructed on the city's outskirts, many people moved in because they'd heard that the subway line would be extended up to this area in the future, and thus most were very hopeful regarding the extension of the line; however, the plan is nowhere in sight because of the strained state of Kyoto City's public finances (for details, see "The plan for westward extension").
sen.cmt: 「西部への延伸構想」 を後述のタイトルに合わせました。

sen.j: 六地蔵駅から山科駅までは伏見区東部・山科区を京都外環状線の地下を通って南北に走る。
sen.e: The line between Rokujizo Station and Yamashina Station runs in a north-south direction through the underground of the Kyoto-sotokanjo-sen Belt Line in eastern Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.
The line between Rokujizo Station and Yamashina Station runs in a north-south direction through the underground of the Kyoto-sotokanjo-sen Belt Line in eastern Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.
The line between Rokujizo Station and Yamashina Station runs in a north-south direction through the underground of the Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway in eastern Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.
sen.cmt: 京都外環状線→Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway としました。

sen.j: 山科駅から蹴上駅まで山を迂回するようにカーブし、蹴上駅から二条駅までは市内中心部を三条通・御池通・押小路通の地下を通って東西に走っている。
sen.e: It curves around the mountain from Yamashina Station to Keage Station and runs in an east-west direction through the underground of the Sanjo-dori Street, Oike-dori Street and Oshikoji-dori Street in the city center from Keage Station to Nijo Station.

It curves around the mountain from Yamashina Station to Keage Station and runs in an east-west direction through the underground of Sanjo-dori Street, Oike-dori Street and Oshikoji-dori Street in the city center from Keage Station to Nijo Station.

It curves around the mountain from Yamashina Station to Keage Station and runs in an east-west direction through the underground of Sanjo-dori Street, Oike-dori Street and Oshikoji-dori Street in the city center from Keage Station to Nijo Station.

sen.j: なお、烏丸御池～二条城前間と京都市役所前～三条京阪間の2か所にもカーブがある。
sen.e: There is also a sharp curve in the section between Karasuma Oike and Nijojo-mae and the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae and Sanjo-keihan, respectively.
There are also sharp curves in the section between Karasuma Oike and Nijojo-mae and the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae and Sanjo-keihan.
There are also sharp curves in the section between Karasuma Oike and Nijojo-mae and the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae and Sanjo-keihan.

sen.j: 京都市中心部で東西方向に走っていることから、東西線と名付けられているが、東西方向に走っているのは全体の半分程度である。
sen.e: Although the name of the line is derived from the fact that it runs in an east-west (tozai) direction in the center of Kyoto City, the distance of the section that runs in an east-west direction is only about half of the entire line.

Although the name of the line is derived from the fact that it runs in an east-west (tozai) direction in the center of Kyoto City, the distance of the section that runs in an east-west direction is only about half the entire line.

Although the name of the line is derived from the fact that it runs in an east-west (tozai) direction in the center of Kyoto City, the distance of the section that runs in an east-west direction is only about half the entire line.

sen.j: 全ての駅にホームドアが設置されている。
sen.e: A platform door is installed on all station platforms of the Tozai Line.
Platform doors are installed on all station platforms of the Tozai Line.
Platform doors are installed on all station platforms of the Tozai Line.

sen.j: 太秦天神川駅から御陵駅では、4両編成と6両編成の両方が発着する関係で、これらの駅ではホームドアは4両部分のみの開閉も行うことが可能になっており、現にそうした運用がなされている。
sen.e: Because two different types of trains, 4-car train and 6-car train, are used in the section between Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station and Misasagi Station, the platform doors for 4-car train alone can be operated on the station platforms in this section, and they are actually operated in this way.

Because two different types of trains--four-car and six-car trains--are used in the section between Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station and Misasagi Station, only the platform doors for four-car trains can be operated on the station platforms in this section, and they are actually operated in this way.

Because two different types of trains--four-car and six-car trains--are used in the section between Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station and Misasagi Station, only the platform doors for four-car trains can be operated on the station platforms in this section, and they are in fact operated in this way.

sen.j: 地下鉄でのホームドアの採用は東京地下鉄南北線に次いで、当路線が日本国内2例目である。
sen.e: The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway is the second subway line on which platform doors are adopted after the Nanboku Line of Tokyo Metro.
sen.cmt: 「Co., Ltd」は意図的に省きました。
sen.e: The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway, is the second subway line on which platform doors were adopted, after the Nanboku Line of Tokyo Metro.
The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway is the second subway line on which platform doors were adopted, after the Nanboku Line of Tokyo Metro.

sen.j: また、各駅毎にステーションカラーと呼ばれるシンボルカラーが選定されており、ホームドアのほか、駅名表示部、駅名パネル、駅務室の外壁、エレベーターの扉などがその色で統一されている。
sen.e: Moreover, each station has its representative color, called "station color," and station parts including the platform door, station name signs, station name panel, external wall of the station attendant office and elevator door are colored in an appropriate station color.

Moreover, each station has its representative color, called a "station color," and station parts such as the platform door, station name signs, station name panel, external wall of the station attendant's office and elevator doors are colored in the corresponding station color.

Moreover, each station has its representative color, called a "station color," and station parts such as the platform door, station name signs, station name panel, external wall of the station attendant's office and elevator doors are colored in the corresponding station color.

sen.j: このステーションカラーは駅一覧のようにグラデーションしていく。
sen.e: These station colors are selected gradationally as shown in "List of stations."
These station colors are selected gradationally as shown in "List of stations."
These station colors are selected gradationally as shown in "List of stations."

sen.j: 駅は全てプラットホームで、エレベーター、エスカレータを完備しているほか、トイレの段差をなくしたり、車いす用スペースを設けたりして、バリアフリーが心掛けられている。
sen.e: Each station employs a platform system and has an elevator and an escalator, and additionally, is made progressively barrier-free by, for example, eliminating difference in level on the bathroom floor and setting a space for wheelchairs.

Each station employs a platform system and has an elevator and an escalator; moreover, it's made progressively barrier-free by, for example, eliminating difference in level on the bathroom floor and including a space for wheelchairs.

Each station employs a platform system and has an elevator and an escalator; moreover, it's made progressively barrier-free by, for example, eliminating difference in level on the bathroom floor and including a space for wheelchairs.

sen.j: 醍醐駅、烏丸御池駅を除くと、すべて改札口は1箇所である。
sen.e: Except for Daigo Station and Karasuma Oike Station, all other stations have only one ticket wicket.
Except for Daigo Station and Karasuma Oike Station, all other stations have only one ticket wicket.
Except for Daigo Station and Karasuma Oike Station, all other stations have only one ticket gate.

sen.j: エレベーターはほぼすべての駅で油圧式、11名乗り、一部点字表示、音声案内付きに統一されている（メーカーは各駅異なる）。
sen.e: Most stations uniformly adopt a hydraulic elevator for 11 people and some of them have Braille signs and a spoken guidance system (elevator makers vary from station to station).
Most stations uniformly adopt hydraulic elevators with room for 11 people, and some of them have Braille signs and a spoken guidance system (the elevator makers vary from station to station).
Most stations uniformly adopt hydraulic elevators with room for 11 people, and some of them have Braille signs and a spoken guidance system (the elevator makers vary from station to station).

sen.j: エスカレーターは駅により上りのみか、上下とも完備されている駅と2タイプあり、全駅ともセンサー式自動運転である。
sen.e: The escalators may be up only or up-and-down depending on the station but all of them are automatic escalators with a sensor.
The escalators may be up only or up-and-down, depending on the station, but all of them are automatic escalators with sensors.
The escalators may be up only or up-and-down, depending on the station, but all of them are automatic escalators with sensors.

Melody signaling departure and announcement regarding train arrival

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄で唯一発車メロディがあるが、4曲全てが京都の長い歴史を反映してか古風な雰囲気の曲である。
sen.e: The Tozai Line is the only line of Kyoto City Subway, which has melodies signaling departure, and all of the four melodies sound quaint, reflecting the long history of Kyoto.
The Tozai Line is the only line of Kyoto City Subway that has melodies to signal departure, and all of the four melodies sound quaint, reflecting Kyoto's extensive history.
The Tozai Line is the only line of Kyoto Municipal Subway that has melodies to signal departure, and all of the four melodies sound quaint, reflecting Kyoto's extensive history.

sen.j: 製作した櫻井音楽工房/テイチクエンタテインメントはこの実績を買われ、後に東日本旅客鉄道の発車メロディを担当することになる。
sen.e: In recognition of their achievement in producing these melodies, Sakurai Music Factory Limited Partnership and Teichiku Entertainment, Inc. would take charge of producing melodies for East Japan Railway Company (JR East) later.

In recognition of their achievement in producing these melodies, Sakurai Music Factory Limited Partnership and Teichiku Entertainment, Inc., were eventually placed in charge of producing melodies for the East Japan Railway Company (JR East).

sen.j: 太秦天神川駅、もしくは京都市役所前駅～御陵駅の間では、6両編成（東西線車両）と4両編成（京阪京津線からの乗り入れ）が混在しているため、列車到着アナウンスでは、両数がかならず告げられる。
sen.e: At Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station or stations in the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station and Misasagi Station, the number of cars is always announced because 6-car trains (Tozai Line trains) and 4-car trains (trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line) are busily operated.

At Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station or stations in the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station and Misasagi Station, the number of cars is always announced because six-car trains (Tozai Line trains) and four-car trains (trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line) are busily operated.

At Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station or stations in the section between Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station and Misasagi Station, the number of cars is always announced because six-car trains (Tozai Line trains) and four-car trains (trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line) are busily operated.

sen.j: 京阪車が到着したときは、6両分あるホームドアのうち、前方から4両分だけが開く。
sen.e: When a train coming from the Keihan Line arrives at these stations, the platform doors are operated only for 4 cars from the front of the train, out of doors for 6 cars.
When a train coming from the Keihan Line arrives at one of these stations, the platform doors are operated only for four cars from the front of the train, out of doors for six cars.
When a train coming from the Keihan Line arrives at one of these stations, the platform doors are operated only for four cars from the front of the train, out of doors for six cars.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道京阪京津線からの列車が御陵駅から太秦天神川駅まで乗り入れている。
sen.e: Trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway are operated from Misasagi Station up to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station.
Trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway are operated from Misasagi Station up to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station.
Trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway are operated from Misasagi Station up to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station.

sen.j: 1日76往復（平日）の乗り入れ列車のうち、早朝・深夜を除いて28往復が概ね30分間隔で太秦天神川駅まで直通し、他は途中の京都市役所前駅まで運転される。
sen.e: Out of 76 round-trip trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line a day (weekday), 28 trains are directly operated to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station at about 30-minute intervals and the other trains are operated up to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station, an intervening station, except early in the morning and late at night.

Out of 76 round-trip trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line each weekday, 28 are directly operated to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station at intervals of approximately 30 minutes, while the other trains are operated up to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station--an intervening station--except early in the morning and late at night.

Out of 76 round-trip trains coming from the Keihan Keishin Line each weekday, 28 are directly operated to Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station at intervals of approximately 30 minutes, while the other trains are operated up to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station--an intervening station--except early in the morning and late at night.

sen.j: 交通局の車両を使用する列車は東西線内六地蔵～太秦天神川駅間の運転で、交通局車は京阪京津線へは乗り入れない。
sen.e: Trains using cars of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau are operated only in the section between Rokujizo Station and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station on the Tozai Line and are not operated onto the Keihan Keishin Line.
sen.cmt: 「交通局」とは「京都市交通局」のことと判断いたしました。
sen.e: Trains using cars of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau are operated only in the section between Rokujizo Station and Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station on the Tozai Line; they aren't operated onto the Keihan Keishin Line.

sen.j: 京津線は大津市内に併用軌道を抱えているため、浜大津発の京都市役所前・太秦天神川行き列車では東西線内でも1～2分程度の遅れが発生することが多い。
sen.e: Since the Keishin Line has some streetcar lines in Otsu City, trains that start from Hamaotsu and arrive at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station or Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station tend to be late for one or two minutes in the Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: 「併用軌道」とは「道路上に敷設された軌道の事を指す。路面電車などで良く見かける敷設形態だが、一般的な鉄道車両が走行する場合もある。」と判明したため、下記を参考にして訳語を採用いたしました。http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e8%b7%af%e9%9d%a2%e9%9b%bb%e8%bb%8a%e3%81%ae%e8%b7%af%e7%b7%9a/UTF-8/
sen.e: Because the Keishin Line has some streetcar lines in Otsu City, trains that start from Hamaotsu and arrive at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station or Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station tend to be late for one or two minutes on the Tozai Line.

Because the Keishin Line has some streetcar lines in Otsu City, trains that depart from Hamaotsu and arrive at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station or Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station tend to be late for one or two minutes on the Tozai Line.

sen.j: この遅れが後続の六地蔵発の太秦天神川駅行きの列車に影響することもある。
sen.e: This delay can affect trains starting from Rokujizo Station and arriving at Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station, which wait for passengers transferred from the delayed train.

sen.j: 日中のダイヤは15分間隔で運転される京津線からの直通列車を除けば、開業当初は全線で10分間隔（1時間あたり6本）だったが、2000年3月に烏丸御池駅で連絡する京都市営地下鉄烏丸線と運転間隔を揃えるためもあり7分半間隔（1時間あたり8本）に増発され、これにより15分あたり東西線内列車2本：京津線直通列車1本のパターンになった。
sen.e: Trains used to be operated every 10 minutes (6 trains per hour) at the beginning of the inauguration throughout the line, except trains coming from the Keishin Line; however, trains have been operated every 7.5 minutes (8 trains per hour) to synchronize the time schedule with trains operated on the Karasuma Line, Kyoto City Subway, which are connected to trains operated on the Tozai Line at Karasuma Oike Station, since March 2000, resulting in a ratio of trains operated on the Tozai Line to those operated directly to the Keishin Line of 2 to 1 per quarter-hour.

Trains used to be operated every ten minutes (six trains per hour) at the beginning of the inauguration throughout the line, except for trains coming from the Keishin Line; however, since March 2000 trains have been operated every 7.5 minutes (eight trains per hour) in order to synchronize the time schedule with trains operated on the Karasuma Line, Kyoto City Subway, which are connected to trains operated on the Tozai Line at Karasuma Oike Station, resulting in a ratio of 2:1 per quarter hour for trains operated on the Tozai Line relative to those operated directly to the Keishin Line.

Trains used to be operated every ten minutes (six trains per hour) during the day at the beginning of the inauguration throughout the line, except for trains coming from the Keishin Line which runs at a 15-minute interval; however, since March 2000 trains have been operated every 7.5 minutes (eight trains per hour) in order to synchronize the time schedule with trains operated on the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway, which are connected to trains operated on the Tozai Line at Karasuma Oike Station, resulting in a ratio of 2:1 per quarter hour for trains operated on the Tozai Line relative to those operated directly to the Keishin Line.
sen.cmt: 「15分間隔、日中」 を追加しました。

sen.j: 2008年1月16日の太秦天神川延伸開業後は京津線からの直通列車を含めると京都市役所前～太秦天神川間で昼間1時間あたり10本の運転間隔となり、烏丸線よりも本数が多くなった。

sen.j: 山科醍醐地域の住民の貴重な足となっている。

sen.j: この地域は、団地や新興住宅地が多く、京都や大阪のベッドタウンを形成しているが、周辺道路事情の悪さから渋滞が慢性化している土地柄である。
sen.e: This region has a lot of housing estates and new residential areas, and forms bedroom suburbs of Kyoto and Osaka; however, traffic in this region is chronically heavy due to bad surrounding road conditions.

This region has a lot of housing estates and new residential areas that form bedroom suburbs of Kyoto and Osaka; however, traffic in this region is chronically heavy due to poor surrounding road conditions.

sen.j: 地下鉄開業前は、京阪京津線などを除くと時間の読めない路線バスしか選択肢がなかったが、地下鉄開業により大幅にアクセスが改善された。
sen.e: Before the subway was opened to traffic, except the Keihan Keishin Line, route buses that seldom ran on schedules were the only means of transportation, but the inauguration of the subway has drastically improved the traffic convenience.

Before the subway was opened to traffic, except for the Keihan Keishin Line, route buses that seldom ran according to schedule were the only means of transportation; however, the inauguration of the subway has drastically improved the traffic convenience.

sen.j: なお、交通局の合理化政策の一環として、開業に合わせて、1997年に同地区の市バスは全て京阪バスに移管された。
sen.e: Incidentally, with the inauguration of the subway, the control of all city buses in the region was transferred to Keihan Bus Co., Ltd. in 1997 as a part of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau's rationalization policy.

sen.e: Keihan Bus Co., Ltd., which had been operating route buses in the Yamashina-Daigo region previously, changed routes drastically in accordance with the transfer of the control and the inauguration of the subway.

sen.j: 上記3区間ではいずれも地下鉄東西線より安い運賃であることや、繁華街である四条河原町に乗り入れていることで、東西線の有力な競争相手となっている。

sen.e: After the war, Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau considered a line (even an overhead line) that would run longitudinally along the Oike-dori Street from Rokujizo to Keage through Daigo and Yamashina, as a blueprint for construction project on new railway line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar; however, the project was overwhelmed by the wave of motorization and derailed.

sen.j: 東西線沿線は人口の伸びが著しい傾向を見せるが、それに周辺の道路整備が追い付かずに渋滞が深刻化していた京都市東部地域（山科区・伏見区東部）と都心部をつなぐための交通機関として1965年頃から計画が進められ、1969年の市議会で建設が正式に決定。
sen.e: The project for the Tozai Line started around 1965 as a public transportation that would connect the eastern region of Kyoto City (Yamashina Ward and eastern Fushimi Ward), where the construction of surrounding roads along the Tozai Line could not keep up with the rapid population growth in these areas, resulting in a serious traffic jam, and the large cities, and carried officially in a city council meeting in 1969.

sen.j: 二条駅までの開業の際、京阪京津線の乗り入れが当初予定していた三条京阪ではなく、その次の京都市役所前までだったのは、三条京阪駅西側はすぐ急カーブとなっている上に、直上に鴨川が流れているため、折り返し線設置には向いておらず、同駅付近では折り返し運転をするのに必要な空間が確保できなかったためである。
sen.e: The reason why the Keihan Keishin Line was extended to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae instead of Sanjo-keihan, the station up to which the line was originally extended, when its operation was extended up to Nijo Station, was because a sharp curve exists right western side of Sanjo-keihan Station, as well as Kamo-gawa River runs right above the point, thereby making it impossible to ensure a space needed for setting up a return track line near Sanjo-keihan Station under such an unfavorable condition.

sen.j: 一方、二条駅まで乗り入れなかったのは、京都市交通局にとって車両使用料がかさむこと（相互乗り入れではなく、京阪車両の東西線への片乗り入れのため、乗り入れ車両の延べ走行距離に応じた車両使用料を、京都市交通局が一方的に京阪電気鉄道に支払わなければならない）、地上側の電力設備の増強が必要なこと、輸送力が過剰になること（二条～京都市役所前間を増発する必要性に乏しい）などが理由である。
sen.e: On the other hand, the reason why it was not extended up to Nijo Station was because Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau would need to pay extra fee for use of railway cars (the fee is required because only Keihan trains use the Tozai Line instead of mutual use between the two organizations, and thus Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau must pay the fee to Keihan Electric Railway one-sidedly depending on the total amount travel distance), the enhancement of the electric power system on the ground would be needed, and the carrying capacity would be too much (it is in little need for increasing the number of trains for the section between Nijo and Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae).

sen.j: その結果、京都市役所前の西隣の烏丸御池での京都市営地下鉄烏丸線との接続に問題が生じる結果を招き、『たった1駅の差で足止めされる』との烏丸線乗換客からの不平不満の声も散見されていた。

sen.j: 日ノ岡駅が御陵駅に統合される形で残ったのとは違って、代替駅の建設予定がなかった九条山駅周辺住民からは地下鉄駅設置の要望が出ていたが、難工事が予想された上に利用者が余り見込めないことから、計画段階当初より代替駅を建設する意思はなかった。
sen.e: Unlike the case where Hinooka Station remained though it was integrated into Misasagi Station, there had been no plan to set up an alternative station of Kujoyama Station since the early planning stages because it was expected to be a killer construction and no prospect of many users was seen, despite the fact that residents near Kujoyama Station had been requesting to establish an alternative subway station.

sen.j: 要望に対しては「バスを増設することによって対処する」との非現実的な返答（渋滞解消のための地下鉄建設であり、重複路線にバスを増設するはずがない）があったがそれもその場しのぎの逃げ口上であり、結局は空手形に終わった。
sen.e: In response to the request, the authorities gave an unrealistic answer saying "We will deal with this issue by increasing the bus services" (the major purpose of the subway construction was to cut traffic jams, so increasing the bus services represents a paradox), which was a temporizing reply and thus a fictitious story.

sen.e: As of October 2007, bus services are provided from Kujoyama Bus Stop (located nearly at the same place where Kujoyama Station is located) to the directions of Sanjo-keihan and Yamashina Station; however, only one or two services for Sanjo-keihan are available an hour during daytime hours, indicating that the number of services is much less compared to the Keihan Keishin Line period in which 4 train services were available an hour.

tit.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線と京阪電気鉄道京津線
tit.e: Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway and Keishin Line, Keihan Electric Railway
Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway; Keishin Line, Keihan Electric Railway
Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway; Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線の建設は、1971年（昭和46年）の都市交通審議会の答申で具体化したが、山科～三条間のルートが当時営業していた京阪京津線の京阪山科～三条間と競合するため、京都市と京阪電気鉄道との間で協議が必要となった。
sen.e: The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway was fleshed out by a report of the Metropolitan Transportation Council in 1971; however, Kyoto City and Keihan Electric Railway needed to take counsel together because the route between Yamashina and Sanjo was competing with the route between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo of the Keihan Keishin Line.

The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway was fleshed out by a report of the Metropolitan Transportation Council in 1971; however, Kyoto City and Keihan Electric Railway needed to take counsel together because the route between Yamashina and Sanjo was competing with the route between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo of the Keihan Keishin Line.

The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto Municipal Subway was fleshed out by a report of the Metropolitan Transportation Council in 1971; however, Kyoto City and Keihan Electric Railway needed to take counsel together because the route between Yamashina and Sanjo was competing with the route between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo of the Keihan Keishin Line.

sen.j: その協議の場において京都市側は、山科から現ルートよりも北側を山岳トンネルで貫いて京都市都心部へ直行する案を提示したが、京阪電気鉄道側が両線が競合するほどの輸送量は無いとこれに反対し、京阪電気鉄道が京津線の京阪山科～三条間を廃止し、京都市営地下鉄東西線へ乗り入れることで決着した。
sen.e: In the counsel, Kyoto City suggested an idea of passing the area to the north of the existing route with a mountain tunnel from Yamashina and connecting the line directly to the downtown Kyoto; however, Keihan Electric Railway disagreed with the idea, insisting that the passenger transportation volume was not large enough for the two lines to compete each other, and eventually, both sides agreed to discontinue the section between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo on the Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway and let Keihan Electric Railway use the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway.

In the counsel, Kyoto City suggested an idea of passing the area to the north of the existing route with a mountain tunnel from Yamashina and connecting the line directly to downtown Kyoto; however, Keihan Electric Railway disagreed with the idea, insisting that the passenger transportation volume wasn't sufficient for the two lines to compete with each other, so eventually both sides agreed to discontinue the section between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo on the Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway and allow Keihan Electric Railway to use the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway.

In the counsel, Kyoto City suggested an idea of passing the area to the north of the existing route with a mountain tunnel from Yamashina and connecting the line directly to downtown Kyoto; however, Keihan Electric Railway disagreed with the idea, insisting that the passenger transportation volume wasn't sufficient for the two lines to compete with each other, so eventually both sides agreed to discontinue the section between Keihan-yamashina and Sanjo on the Keishin Line of Keihan Electric Railway and allow Keihan Electric Railway to use the Tozai Line, Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: その後、東西線の山科付近のルートの都合で、浜大津方面から京津線の山科での乗り入れは物理的に不可能となり、京津線と東西線との接続駅として、三条通を走る日ノ岡～御陵間に地下鉄御陵駅を新設し、ここに京津線の御陵駅を移設・地下化することに決まった。
sen.e: After that, due to some problems of the route of the Tozai Line near Yamashina, it became physically impossible for trains of the Keishin Line from the direction of Hamaotsu to be connected to the Tozai Line at Yamashina, and thus the related parties decided to adopt an idea of newly establishing the subway Misasagi Station, as a connection station of the Keishin Line and the Tozai Line, in the section between Hinooka and Misasagi, which was running along the Sanjo-dori Street, and moving and undergrounding Misasagi Station of the Keishin Line there.

Subsequently, due to problems concerning the route of the Tozai Line near Yamashina, it became physically impossible for trains of the Keishin Line coming from the direction of Hamaotsu to connect to the Tozai Line at Yamashina, and thus the related parties decided to adopt the idea of newly establishing the subway Misasagi Station as a connection station of the Keishin Line and the Tozai Line, doing so in the section between Hinooka and Misasagi, which was running along Sanjo-dori Street, and thus to move Misasagi Station of the Keishin Line underground.

Subsequently, due to problems concerning the route of the Tozai Line near Yamashina, it became physically impossible for trains of the Keishin Line coming from the direction of Hamaotsu to connect to the Tozai Line at Yamashina, and thus the related parties decided to adopt the idea of newly establishing the subway Misasagi Station as a connection station of the Keishin Line and the Tozai Line, doing so in the section between Hinooka and Misasagi, which was running along Sanjo-dori Street, and thus to move Misasagi Station of the Keishin Line underground.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線の建設主体は、醍醐～御陵間6.3kmと三条京阪～二条間3.3kmの計9.4kmは京都市の施工、京阪京津線の置き換え区間となる御陵～三条京阪間3.3kmは京都市・京阪電気鉄道などが出資する第三セクター京都高速鉄道を設立して日本鉄道建設公団の施工となった。
sen.e: The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway was divided between Kyoto City, which would undertake the section between Daigo and Misasagi (6.3km) and the section between Sanjo-keihan (3.3km), accounting for a total of 9.4km, and Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation with establishment of Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., a joint public-private venture of Kyoto City, Keihan Electric Railway and some other enterprises, which would undertake the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan (3.3km), which would be replaced for the Keihan Keishin Line.

The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway, was divided between Kyoto City, which would undertake the section between Daigo and Misasagi (6.3km) and the section between Sanjo-keihan (3.3km), accounting for a total of 9.4km, and the Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation with the establishment of Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., a joint public-private venture of Kyoto City, Keihan Electric Railway and certain other enterprises that would undertake the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan (3.3km), which would be replaced by the Keihan Keishin Line.

The construction of the Tozai Line, Kyoto Municipal Subway, was divided between Kyoto City, which would undertake the section between Daigo and Misasagi (6.3 km) and the section between Sanjo-keihan and Nijo (3.3km), accounting for a total of 9.4 km, and the Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation with the establishment of Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., a joint public-private venture of Kyoto City, Keihan Electric Railway and certain other enterprises that would undertake the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan (3.3 km), which would be replaced by the Keihan Keishin Line.

sen.j: そして、鉄道施設の完成後、京都高速鉄道が日本鉄道建設公団から25年間の分割払いで鉄道施設を譲り受け、京都市交通局に貸与し、京都市交通局が醍醐～二条間を一体的に運営することになり、1987年4月1日の国鉄分割民営化によって、それまでの「地方鉄道法」が廃止され、新たに「鉄道事業法」が施行されたことによって、京都市交通局が醍醐～御陵間と三条京阪～二条間の第一種鉄道事業者、御陵～三条京阪間の第二種鉄道事業者となり、京都高速鉄道が御陵～三条京阪間の第三種鉄道事業者となったことから、京阪電気鉄道も第二種鉄道事業者という経営形態が確立されたため、京津線の御陵～三条間の旅客営業を廃止せず、京都市交通局とともに京都高速鉄道から鉄道施設を借り受け、同区間の地下化、ルート変更する形で旅客営業を継続してはどうかと再検討されたが、諸経費などの絡みで既定方針どおりとなった。
sen.e: After the subway facilities were completed, Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd. bought the subway facilities from Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation on the installment plan over 25 years to lend them to Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau, and Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau was supposed to operate the section between Daigo and Nijo integrally, and accordingly Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau became a first class railway enterprise for the section between Daigo and Misasagi and the section between Sanjo-keihan and Nijo, and a second class railway enterprise for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan while Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd. became a third class railway enterprise for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan based on the Railway Business Act, which newly took effect after the old local railway law had been abolished when Japanese National Railways was split and privatized on April 1, 1987, so Keihan Electric Railway was also positioned as a second class railway enterprise; therefore, an idea of continuing the passenger services in the section between Misasagi and Sanjo on the Keishin Line, borrowing the subway facilities from Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd. in cooperation with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau to underground and change the route of the relevant section was reexamined; however, the involved parties decided to follow the established policy due to overhead expenses.

After the subway facilities were completed, Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., bought the subway facilities from the Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation using a 25-year installment plan in order to lend them to the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau, which would in turn operate the section between Daigo and Nijo integrally, and accordingly the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau became a first-class railway enterprise for the sections between Daigo and Misasagi and between Sanjo-keihan and Nijo, as well as a second-class railway enterprise for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan, while Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., became a third-class railway enterprise for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan based on the Railway Business Act, which had taken effect after the abolishment of the old local railway law when Japanese National Railways was split and privatized on April 1, 1987, whereby Keihan Electric Railway was also positioned as a second-class railway enterprise; therefore, the idea of continuing passenger services in the section between Misasagi and Sanjo on the Keishin Line, borrowing the subway facilities from Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., in cooperation with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau to underground and change the route of the relevant section was re-examined; however, the parties involved decided to follow the established policy due to overhead expenses.

After the subway facilities were completed, Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., bought the subway facilities from the Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation using a 25-year installment plan in order to lend them to the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau, which would in turn operate the section between Daigo and Nijo integrally, and accordingly the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau became a Type I Railway Business Operator for the sections between Daigo and Misasagi and between Sanjo-keihan and Nijo, as well as a Type II Railway Business Operator for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan, while Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., became a Type Ⅲ Railway Business Operator for the section between Misasagi and Sanjo-keihan based on the Railway Business Act, which had taken effect after the abolishment of the old local railway law when Japanese National Railways was split and privatized on April 1, 1987, whereby Keihan Electric Railway was also positioned as a Type II Railway Business Operator; therefore, the idea of continuing passenger services in the section between Misasagi and Sanjo on the Keishin Line, borrowing the subway facilities from Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd., in cooperation with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau to underground and change the route of the relevant section was re-examined; however, the parties involved decided to follow the established policy due to overhead expenses.
sen.cmt: 第X種鉄道事業者→Type X Railway Business Operator としました。

sen.j: もっとも、京都市交通局事業の慢性赤字や開業後の京阪電気鉄道の大津線事業の不振という現状から、京阪電気鉄道が第二種事業免許を取得し、業務委託などの形で事実上譲り受け、京津線と一体運営すべきという改善案も今なお一部に存在する。
sen.e: Given the fact that Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau has stayed mired in the red chronically and Keihan Electric Railway has been in business depression regarding the Otsu Line, some people are still advocating an improvement in which Keihan Electric Railway should obtain a qualification of a second class railway enterprise and take over the subway facilities in a business trust agreement to operate the Tozai Line integrally with the Keishin Line.

Given the fact that Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau has been chronically mired in red ink and Keihan Electric Railway has been in a business depression with regard to the Otsu Line, some people are still advocating an improvement in which Keihan Electric Railway would obtain qualification as a second-class railway enterprise and take over the subway facilities in a business-trust agreement in order to operate the Tozai Line integrally with the Keishin Line.

Given the fact that Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau has been chronically mired in red ink and Keihan Electric Railway has been in a business depression with regard to the Otsu Line, some people are still advocating an improvement in which Keihan Electric Railway would obtain qualification as a Type II Railway Business Operator and take over the subway facilities in a business-trust agreement in order to operate the Tozai Line integrally with the Keishin Line.
sen.cmt: 第X種鉄道事業者→Type X Railway Business Operator としました。

tit.e: The current situation and future prospects
The current situation and future prospects

sen.j: 東西線は西京区の洛西方面および長岡京市までの延伸が構想として存在するが、差し当たり太秦天神川までの延伸に留まり、その後の延伸の具体的展望はなかなか描かれていない。
sen.e: Although there is an idea of extending the Tozai Line up to the direction of Rakusai in Nishikyo Ward and Nagaokakyo City, the project has been put on ice after the line was extended up to Uzumasa-tenjingawa without making any substantial progress on the future plan.

sen.j: 洛西ニュータウンに至るまでの梅津・上桂地域などの沿線人口がそれほど多くない上に、阪急京都本線と競合する。
sen.e: Not only the areas along the Tozai Line up to Rakusai New Town, including Umezu and Kamikatsura areas, do not have a large population but this areas would compete against the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line.

sen.j: 洛西ニュータウン自体の人口が横ばいあるいは減少傾向。

sen.j: 阪急桂駅以外に、阪急洛西口駅がすでに整備され、またJRの新駅（JR桂駅・仮称）も設置予定なことで、交通の不便さがある程度解消されてきた。
sen.e: As Rakusaiguchi Station has already been completed other than Katsura Station of Hankyu Railway and another JR's new station (JR Katsura Station: tentative) is scheduled to be set up, leading to gradual resolution of the inconveniences of traffic.

sen.j: そのため、洛西ニュータウンへの路線は既存の計画とは切り離した上で、洛西口駅・JR桂駅までの独立した短距離路線で建設して、これらの駅での阪急京都線・JR京都線乗り換えで京都・大阪への都心部へのアクセスを向上させる方がまだ現実的と言う意見もある。
sen.e: Therefore, there are some opinions saying that constructing a new track line to Rakusai New Town should be separated from the existing plan and another independent short-distance line should be established up to Rakusaiguchi Station and JR Katsura Station so that access to central Kyoto and central Osaka can be improved by transferring trains to the Hankyu Kyoto Line or the JR Kyoto Line at these stations.

sen.e: In the groundbreaking ceremony for the extension of Subway Tenjingawa (tentative name at the time) held in 2002, Mr. Yorikane MASUMOTO, the president and the mayor of Kyoto City at the time, expressed the expansion of the subway line up to Rakusai as "My ardent wish."

sen.e: Therefore, on May 12, 2008, Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau announced that they would dissolve Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd. by the end of 2008 and the entire Tozai Line would be under direct control of Kyoto City in 2009.

sen.cmt: fiscal を追加しました。fiscal 2008→fiscal year 2008に変更しました。fiscal 2009→fiscal year 2009に変更しました。

sen.j: これは、京都市交通局が京都高速鉄道に建設費返済の財源として、年間55億円の線路使用料を支払っているが当初の借入金が高金利であること、人件費など会社の経費もかさむことなどが、地下鉄の経営悪化の要因となっているためである。
sen.e: This announcement was made based on the fact that Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau has been paying the track line usage fee of 5.5 billion yen a year as a financial resource for the construction cost repayment, but a high interest rate was set for the first borrowing and company expenses such as a labor cost would pile up, which are becoming factors of worsening business conditions of the subway.

This announcement was made based on the fact that the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau has been paying the track line-usage fee of 5.5 billion yen per year as a financial resource for repayment of the construction cost, but a high interest rate was set for the first loan and company expenses such as labor cost began to pile up; these are becoming factors in the subway's worsening business condition.
